page.title: 02Life in the Porthpean area.
page.content: The nearest town of any size,ST. Austell,is the centre for work,schools ,shopping and many forms of entertain- -ment. Outlying villagers try to generate community spirit by maintaining tradi- -itional Feast Weeks or Feast Days,in honour of early Cornish Saints or the foundation of churches,added to which are Carnival Weeks and concerts for bands,choirs and cornish speaking. The area is rural and peaceful.Those who move here to live comment upon the security and freedom from the fears of street violence.Community spirit is strong,including all ages in local activities. Young people living here spend alot of their time on the beach or the sea. Sailing and fishing are very popular, in poor weather there are usually rep- -airs to be done on boats and tackle.
